title: Is it true that event giant dinosaurs were likely far less intelligent than small modern birds? - Quora

response.answer_text: Most likely yes. Brain size alone does not connote intelligence. A human brain is MUCH bigger than a crow, yet both are intelligent creatures. The real question is the brain-body ratio. Humans are similar in size to pigs and big cats, but our brains are MUCH larger than either of theirs. The larger dinosaurs had small brains relative to their bodies, especially for the sauropods. They really didn’t need much brainpower. Therapods, on the other hand, had larger brains relative to their bodies, as they needed to be clever to catch fast or well-armed and/or armored prey. Imagine taking on a ankylosaurus, a walking tank, with your bare hands.
